item.title: Hello Sunshine looks like an Iron Giant inspired survival RPG
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/03/15/hello-sunshine-looks-like-an-iron-giant-inspired-survival-rpg/

Developer Red Thread Games has announced its next game which is titled Hello Sunshine, and it looks like one inspiration could be The Iron Giant. The teaser shows you character, who is the last employee of the Hello Sunshine corporation, who is looking for something to quench their thirst. Unfortunately, the bottle they find is empty so they chuck it and, inadvertently, wake up a hostile robot. Luckily, a friendly robot comes in to save the day. A release date is yet to be confirmed, and Hello Sunshine seems to be PC only at the moment.

Hello Sunshine is a survival RPG in which you and the robot are journeying along a road to reach the tower at the end of it. That tower holds the fate of the entire world. There is a day and night cycle in the game as well. In the day, the sun’s heat can be deadly so staying in the robots shadow gives some relief. During this time scavenging for supplies and looking for puzzle pieces is the key focus, while at night you will need to make camp while the robot recharges, crafting supplies and carrying out any repairs for the robot. You will be able to craft smaller robots to help with scavenging and other tasks. As an employee of Hello Sunshine you can complete tasks that improves your employee rank, which in turn unlocks bonuses such as vending machines and rest areas, which will be needed in this desert. Hello Sunshine will also feature co-op.

Dustborn Review

In our Dustborn review, Gareth said, “While some of its gameplay diversions miss the mark, Dustborn is an excellent example of how to craft engaging characters and wrap a story around them. The game is filled with surprisingly natural sounding conversations, whether they’re serious and detailed or funny and light. It’s very rare that I encounter characters that are so believable in a game. Quite the achievement considering one of those characters is a gruff, bearded New Yorker with dwarfism who heals people by reciting poetry, who I honestly wish I got to spend more time with.”

Source: YouTube

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 15/03/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/03/15/something-for-the-weekend-15-03-25/

There’s a lot of bleary-eyed Formula 1 fans out there today, getting up at Australian times to see the 2025 season start in earnest. There’s also the more sensible fans who stay in bed and watch the re-runs and highlights. Which kind (if any) are you?

In the News This Week

There was big news and announcements all through the week, with these headlines:

  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach is out this June
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 3 is officially in development
  • PowerWash Simulator 2 is set to cleanse consoles and PC later this year
  • Rainbow Six Siege X is going free-to-play and brings big tech improvements in June
  • Niantic sells gaming division and Pokémon Go to Saudi-owned Scopely for $3.5 billion
  • People Can Fly is developing Project Delta based on a Sony-owned IP
  • Silent Hill F revealed with brand new trailer
  • God of War Ragnarök Dark Odyssey Collection update coming March 20th
  • Moon Studios is now self-publishing No Rest for the Wicked after split with Take-Two
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle PS5 release date in April leaks

Games in Review & Featured Articles

We had just the one game review this week, but it’s a very enjoyable game, that’s for sure.

  • Split Fiction – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10

But we made up for that with a fresh tranche of hardware reviews.

  • PXN P5 Wireless Gaming Controller – NSW, PC, Mobile – 8/10
  • Boulies Master Chair Rex – 8/10

And we did have a good batch of previews, going hands on with Rainbow Six Siege X’s new Dual Front game mode, the quirky castle battler Castle V Castle, and the intriguing RPG genre mash-up of The Hundred Line – Last Defense Academy.

There was also the announcement of a Playing With History book! It’s collating and expanding on Ade’s long-running feature series in this Kickstarter project.

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Assassin’s Creed Shadows, Mecha Break & Phasmophobia.

Trailer Park

See 10 minutes of Death Stranding 2: On the Beach

Midnight Murder Club brings its hide, seek & shoot game to early access today

Hitman World of Assassination PSVR 2 release set for 27th March

See Rainbow Six Siege X’s new game mode

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week?

TSBonyman checked out the demo for My Little Universe and reckons it could blossom into a fun timewaster, going around auto-mining resources in a surprisingly engaging way.

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!
